MicrobiomeAnalysis Hua Zou 2022-05-17 Chapter 1 Prerequisites 1.1 Software R 4.1.2 or later release Download link. Rstudio Desktop Download link. 1.2 Requirements The methods in MicrobiomeAnalysis requires that the users should have basic knowledge on R language and statistical background. Statistical Analysis of Microbiome Data with R (Xia et al. 2018) might be a guide book for you. References
Chapter 4 Convert inputs into phyloseq-class object 4.1 loading packages 4.2 inputs from dada2 4.3 inputs from qiime2

Chapter 4 Convert inputs into phyloseq-class object 4.1 loading packages library(MicrobiomeAnalysis) library(dplyr) library(tibble) library(phyloseq) 4.2 inputs from dada2 seq_tab <- readRDS( system.file("extdata", "dada2_seqtab.rds", package = "MicrobiomeAnalysis")) tax_tab <- readRDS( system.file("extdata", "dada2_taxtab.rds", package = "MicrobiomeAnalysis")) sam_tab <- read.table( system.file("extdata", "dada2_samdata.txt", package = "MicrobiomeAnalysis"), sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1) ps <- import_dada2(seq_tab = seq_tab, tax_tab = tax_tab, sam_tab = sam_tab) ps ## phyloseq-class experiment-level object ## otu_table() OTU Table: [ 232 taxa and 20 samples ] ## sample_data() Sample Data: [ 20 samples by 4 sample variables ] ## tax_table() Taxonomy Table: [ 232 taxa by 6 taxonomic ranks ] ## refseq() DNAStringSet: [ 232 reference sequences ] 4.3 inputs from qiime2 otuqza_file <- system.file( "extdata", "table.qza", package = "MicrobiomeAnalysis") taxaqza_file <- system.file( "extdata", "taxonomy.qza", package = "MicrobiomeAnalysis") sample_file <- system.file( "extdata", "sample-metadata.tsv", package = "MicrobiomeAnalysis") treeqza_file <- system.file( "extdata", "tree.qza", package = "MicrobiomeAnalysis") ps <- import_qiime2( otu_qza = otuqza_file, taxa_qza = taxaqza_file, sam_tab = sample_file, tree_qza = treeqza_file) ps ## phyloseq-class experiment-level object ## otu_table() OTU Table: [ 770 taxa and 34 samples ] ## sample_data() Sample Data: [ 34 samples by 9 sample variables ] ## tax_table() Taxonomy Table: [ 770 taxa by 7 taxonomic ranks ] ## phy_tree() Phylogenetic Tree: [ 770 tips and 768 internal nodes ]

Chapter 5 Multivariate Community Analysis 5.1 Multivariate homogeneity of groups dispersions (variances) 5.2 Permutational Multivariate Analysis of Variance (PERMANOVA) 5.3 Mantel Test (MANTEL) 5.4 Analysis of Similarity (ANOSIM) 5.5 Multi-response Permutation Procedures (MRPP)

Chapter 5 Multivariate Community Analysis Know more details of the aftermentioned statistical methods to see (Xia et al. 2018). 5.1 Multivariate homogeneity of groups dispersions (variances) (Anderson, Ellingsen, and McArdle 2006) data("enterotypes_arumugam") run_betadisper(enterotypes_arumugam, variable = "Enterotype", method = "bray") ## ## Permutation test for homogeneity of multivariate dispersions ## Permutation: free ## Number of permutations: 999 ## ## Response: Distances ## Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F N.Perm Pr(>F) ## Groups 5 0.20549 0.041098 2.6297 999 0.048 * ## Residuals 33 0.51573 0.015628 ## --- ## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ## ## Pairwise comparisons: ## (Observed p-value below diagonal, permuted p-value above diagonal) ## Enterotype 1 Enterotype 2 Enterotype 3 Enterotype 3 - twin Infant Unclassified ## Enterotype 1 0.792000 0.587000 0.062000 0.615 ## Enterotype 2 0.783014 0.844000 0.078000 0.394 ## Enterotype 3 0.568759 0.833759 0.028000 0.320 ## Enterotype 3 - twin ## Infant 0.055983 0.086697 0.025895 0.163 ## Unclassified 0.599016 0.393409 0.341476 0.166317 5.2 Permutational Multivariate Analysis of Variance (PERMANOVA) (Anderson 2014) run_PERMANOVA(enterotypes_arumugam, method = "bray") ## SumsOfSample Df SumsOfSqs MeanSqs F.Model R2 Pr(>F) AdjustedPvalue ## SampleID 39 38 5.52824570 0.14548015 0.0000000 1.00000000 1.000 1.000000000 ## Sample.Id 39 38 5.52824570 0.14548015 0.0000000 1.00000000 1.000 1.000000000 ## Enterotype 39 5 2.56076401 0.51215280 5.6954159 0.46321458 0.001 0.001666667 ## Nationality 39 5 2.05227964 0.41045593 3.8967715 0.37123524 0.001 0.001666667 ## Clinical.Status 39 4 0.93273067 0.23318267 1.7252061 0.16872091 0.075 0.107142857 ## Gender 39 1 0.08064267 0.08064267 0.5477232 0.01458739 0.829 1.000000000 ## Project 39 5 2.29920371 0.45984074 4.6994572 0.41590114 0.001 0.001666667 ## Clinical.Status..filtered. 39 5 1.59553654 0.31910731 2.6776811 0.28861534 0.001 0.001666667 ## Nationality..filtered. 39 5 2.38348358 0.47669672 5.0022835 0.43114646 0.001 0.001666667 ## Gender..filtered. 39 2 0.88556964 0.44278482 3.4334193 0.16018999 0.001 0.001666667 5.3 Mantel Test (MANTEL) (Mantel 1967) run_MANTEL(enterotypes_arumugam, y_variables = c("Enterotype", "Clinical.Status"), z_variables = c("Nationality", "Gender"), norm = FALSE, method = "mantel.partial", method_dist = c("bray", "euclidean", "jaccard")) ## ## Partial Mantel statistic based on Spearman's rank correlation rho ## ## Call: ## vegan::mantel.partial(xdis = x_dis, ydis = y_dis, zdis = z_dis, method = method_cor, permutations = 999) ## ## Mantel statistic r: 0.4516 ## Significance: 0.001 ## ## Upper quantiles of permutations (null model): ## 90% 95% 97.5% 99% ## 0.102 0.139 0.163 0.211 ## Permutation: free ## Number of permutations: 999 5.4 Analysis of Similarity (ANOSIM) (Clarke 1993) run_ANOSIM(enterotypes_arumugam, variable = "Enterotype", method = "bray") ## ## Call: ## vegan::anosim(x = dis, grouping = datphe, permutations = 999) ## Dissimilarity: bray ## ## ANOSIM statistic R: 0.6064 ## Significance: 0.001 ## ## Permutation: free ## Number of permutations: 999 5.5 Multi-response Permutation Procedures (MRPP) (Mielke Jr 1991) run_MRPP(enterotypes_arumugam, variable = "Enterotype", method = "bray") ## ## Call: ## vegan::mrpp(dat = dis, grouping = datphe, permutations = 999) ## ## Dissimilarity index: bray ## Weights for groups: n ## ## Class means and counts: ## ## Enterotype 1 Enterotype 2 Enterotype 3 Enterotype 3 - twin Infant Unclassified ## delta 0.3503 0.3721 0.3674 NaN 0.6499 0.3341 ## n 8 6 18 1 4 2 ## ## Chance corrected within-group agreement A: 0.2272 ## Based on observed delta 0.3925 and expected delta 0.5079 ## ## Significance of delta: 0.001 ## Permutation: free ## Number of permutations: 999 References
